channel.title: University
channel.description:
I usually do not attempt to put myself over this side of the site but I would appreciate some input from people with a higher intellect than the stereotypical idiocy of the average moparscapian. Currently I am living in Australia, WA and have one more year left of school before I leave. I have been seriously considering attending uni in a different country, most likely England and am in need of advice. I get fairly good grades and my current goal is to study Psychology in a respectable university. However I am open to different career options and because I am slightly lost in what kind of occupation I want to pursue, some advice on what to study would be greatly appreciated. So where do you study, what do you study and do you really enjoy it?
/request move to general discussion

If you want some sexy gash, then it’s Psychology all the way…

item.title: University
item.dc:creator: @Rixxx Rix_
item.description:
@Rixxx wrote:

Well, the most logical advice I or anyone would give is choosing whatever you’re interested in. There’s no point spending a few years doing something that you don’t like (duh). Also consider what Radeon suggested: pick universities in Australia. If you’re financially stable then obviously opt for universities in the UK or the US.

Perhaps it would be smart if you narrowed down your list to just a few choices.

Read full topic

item.title: University
item.dc:creator: @Man_UTD_Freak Man UTD Freak
item.description:
@Man_UTD_Freak wrote:

Year 11 hoping to study engineering (mechanical is what I am hoping for at the moment but my mind is not fully made up) at a good university.

As other people are saying, I do recommend you doing something else with a broad range of occupations that you enjoy before doing Psychology as it has a more limited range of job opportunities and suppose if you get bored of doing something related with Psych, you always have something else to fall back on.

Read full topic

item.title: University
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

[quote=“xx matty xx, post:15, topic:373235”][quote author=Mr.Chris link=topic=469252.msg3432121#msg3432121 date=1292447932]
I’m doing Computer Science at Leicester uni - The department there gave me £1000 for doing the course, and the Government are giving me £2900 this year for fuck knows what. Life is good. The course is okay, I’m a tiny bit disappointed with it as 3/5 modules in the first semester are just so pointless, but I’m sure it will pick up later.
[/quote]
Was the 1k the eliahou dangoor scholarship, by any chance?[/quote]

No. Just a grant from the department.

Read full topic

item.title: University
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

Phaze One:

Currently at school I am studying psych, sports science, maths, english lit, integrated science & religion (mandatory, it’s a catholic school). I dabble with computers occasionally but it was never something I considered pursuing a career over. What are you guys currently studying?

I’m doing Computer Science because I like it, not because I have any career ideas. You should do something you’re interested in and enjoy, or you’ll be bored shitless.

I’m doing a 4 year course at St Andrews so first year CS is easy for the people who have never programmed anything before. They also love international students because of funding etc. SO COME HERE.

Read full topic

item.title: University
item.dc:creator: @Phaze_One Fuscate
item.description:
@Phaze_One wrote:

[quote=“Radeon, post:8, topic:373235”][quote author=Phaze One link=topic=469252.msg3430808#msg3430808 date=1292327140]

I was gonna talk about Lothy, but then I got high.

I would personally love to study in the UK or USA but to study as an international student at such countries is way too expensive.

Fees would be around $30,000AUD yearly.

UWA courses are approximately $30,000-$120,000AUD depending on what you are studying although the payments are not yearly funds. Anyone have a suggestion of an alternate course?
[/quote]

Are you an Australian citizen? Because if you are, it’d cost you $4000-$9000 annually at UWA depending on the course

Edit: If you have the money for UK/USA don’t think twice, just go for it.[/quote]

Yeah i’m an Australian citizen. The cost is widely varied between each course you want to do. I know the ECU piloting course is over $80,000AUD. I still need to do some research into studying in different countries but the UK is a definite goal.

Greeny:

What are you interested in?

Currently at school I am studying psych, sports science, maths, english lit, integrated science & religion (mandatory, it’s a catholic school). I dabble with computers occasionally but it was never something I considered pursuing a career over. What are you guys currently studying?

Read full topic

item.title: University
item.dc:creator: @MujaheD Radeon
item.description:
@MujaheD wrote:

Well, I recommend that you reconsider your choice of studying psychology. It is interesting but if you want to get a decent job in the future it can be very limiting.

Australia being so massive, you could consider changing state rather than changing countries. There are some decent universities, for example Australian National University.

If you want to study abroad, it can be extremely difficult because it’s VERY expensive. So unless you own a Uranium mine, I don’t think it would be feasible.

Read full topic
